keel.Algorithms.Discretizers.MODL

Class MODL

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Discretizers.Basic.Discretizer
      • keel.Algorithms.Discretizers.MODL.MODL

  • public class MODL
extends Discretizer
    MODL Discretizer, based on the work of Marc Boullé M. Boulle. MODL: A bayes optimal discretization method for continuous attributes. Machine Learning 65:1 (2006) 131-165

    Since:
    JDK 1.5

    Version:
    0.2
    Author:
    Written by Julián Luengo Martín 07/05/2008

        public MODL(java.lang.String processType)
        Parameter constructor. Initializes the discretization scheme with process type.

    • Method Detail

      • discretizeAttribute

        protected java.util.Vector discretizeAttribute(int attribute,
                                               int[] values,
                                               int begin,
                                               int end)
        Description copied from class: Discretizer
        This abstract method creates the cut points of the attribute given using its values for each instances given. Every discretizer should implement this method with its particular scheme.
        Specified by:
        discretizeAttribute in class Discretizer
        Parameters:
        attribute - given attribute to discretize.
        values - given attribute values in the dataset.
        begin - First position of the section to discretize.
        end - Last position of the section to discretize.
        Returns:
        the cut points of the attribute given

      • postOptimizationMODL

        protected java.util.Vector postOptimizationMODL(int attribute,
                                                int[] values,
                                                int begin,
                                                int end)
        Implements the post-optimization procedure for MODL, after obtaining the best initial interval division.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute which is being discretized
        values - the values of the attribute
        begin - the initial position of the values
        end - the final position of the values
        Returns:
        the best discretization scheme found

      • split

        protected Neighbour split(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> interv,
                          int index,
                          int n,
                          int I,
                          int[] values)
        Search for the best cutpoint in a given interval. The best cutpoint is located by means of the cost of each cutpoint (if negative, improves the actual interval).
        Parameters:
        interv - The interval which could be partitioned
        index - Index of the first element of the interval in the complete real value list
        n - Total number of real values
        I - Current number of intervals
        values - Mapping between instance number and the sorted rank by attribute values
        Returns:
        The best cutpoint if found: [0,cutpoint) and [cutpoint,n_i], or -1 if no cutpoint improves the current interval cost

      • applyNeighbour

        public void applyNeighbour(java.util.Vector cp,
                           Neighbour neig)
        Apply the neighbour to the current interval set.
        Parameters:
        cp - The interval set
        neig - The neighbour (Split, MergeSplit or MergeMergeSplit) we want to apply

      • partitionCost

        public double partitionCost(int I,
                            int n)
        Computes the cost of the partition
        Parameters:
        I - the number of intervals
        n - the number of different elements
        Returns:
        the cost of the number of partitions

      • intervalCost

        public double intervalCost(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> interval,
                           int index,
                           int[] values,
                           int I)
        Computes the cost of the interval in the current discretization scheme
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval to be considered
        index - the index of the intial element of the interval in the global array of values
        values - the global array of values
        I - the current number of intervals
        Returns:
        the cost of the interval

      • exhaustiveMerge

        protected java.util.Vector exhaustiveMerge(int attribute,
                                           int[] values,
                                           int begin,
                                           int end)
        Performs an exhaustive bottom-up merge of all unitary intervals to a unique interval. The best configuration is returned.
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute of the data set we are discretizing
        values - Mapping between instance number and the sorted rank by attribute values
        begin - First position of values to be considered.
        end - Last position of values to be considered.
        Returns:
        The best discretization configuration.

      • greedyMODL

        protected java.util.Vector greedyMODL(int attribute,
                                      int[] values,
                                      int begin,
                                      int end)
        This method implements the greedy version of the MODL discretizer. It is a bottom up proccess which merges the two more appropriate intervals, until no improvement can be done to the global MODL value.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute which is being discretized
        values - the global array of values (sorted)
        begin - the initial position of the values to be discretized
        end - the final position of the values to be discretized
        Returns:
        the best discretization scheme found

      • optimalMODL

        protected java.util.Vector optimalMODL(int attribute,
                                       int[] values,
                                       int begin,
                                       int end)
        It seachs for the best possible optimization scheme. It is a VERY slow process, so it is not recommended.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute to be discretized
        values - the global array of values (sorted)
        begin - the initial position of the array
        end - the final position in the array
        Returns:
        the best global discretization scheme

      • modl

        public double modl(java.util.Vector disc,
                   int[] values)
        Computes the MODL value for a current discretization scheme
        Parameters:
        disc - The discretization scheme to be evaluated. Comprises the intervals as ArrayList of values.
        values - Array in which position i there is the number of instance which explanatory (real) value has rank i after sorting
        Returns:
        The MODL value corresponding to the discretization scheme

      • modl

        public double modl(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double>> disc,
                   int[] values)
        Computes the MODL value for a current discretization scheme
        Parameters:
        disc - The discretization scheme to be evaluated. Comprises the intervals as ArrayList of values.
        values - Array in which position i there is the number of instance which explanatory (real) value has rank i after sorting
        Returns:
        The MODL value corresponding to the discretization scheme

      • mergeCostVariation

        public double mergeCostVariation(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> na,
                                 int indexna,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> nb,
                                 int indexnb,
                                 int I,
                                 int[] values)
        Computes the cost derived form merging two adjacent intervals na and nb
        Parameters:
        na - Interval to the left to merge
        indexna - Index of the first element of na in the whole list of real values
        nb - Right interval to merge
        indexnb - Index of the first element of nb in the whole list of real values
        I - Current number of intervals (the total intervals prior to the merging)
        values - Array in which position i there is the number of instance which explanatory (real) value has rank i after sorting
        Returns:
        The cost variation produced by the merge operation

      • factDivision

        public double factDivision(int i,
                           int[] ni,
                           int[][] nij)
        Computes the division of factorials of the form (ni[i]! / (nij[i][0]! * nij[i][1]! *...* nij[i][J-1]!))
        Parameters:
        i - The interval considered
        ni - Number of instances which belong to interval i
        nij - Number of instances of class j which belong to interval i
        Returns:
        the division of factorials of the form

      • factorialLog

        public static double factorialLog(int n)
        Returns the natural logarithm of n!.
        Parameters:
        n - argument
        Returns:
        log(n!)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if preconditions are not met.

      • stirling

        public static double stirling(int n)
        Stirling formula for aproximating Log(n!) in O(1), if n is big enough.
        Parameters:
        n - Number to factorize
        Returns:
        Stirling's approximation to Log(n!)

      • binomialLog

        public static double binomialLog(int m,
                                 int n)
        Returns the natural logarithm of m over n.
        Parameters:
        m - Upper argument
        n - Lower argument
        Returns:
        Log(m over n)

      • combinatoria

        public static double combinatoria(int m,
                                  int n)
        Function that calculates combinatory of two integers
        Parameters:
        m - first integer
        n - second integer
        Returns:
        the combinatory of m and n

      • createCP

        public java.util.Vector createCP(java.util.Vector intervals)
        Construct an array of cutpoints from the set of intervals.
        Parameters:
        intervals - Vector which contains the intervals in ArrayList format
        Returns:
        A Vector with double formatted cutpoints, computed as the midterm between two adjacent intervals.
